snippet: A collection that flaps in the wind; a paper trail for rare furniture; and everyday items and small luxuries from the glory days of American rail travel.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Yale University Art Gallery has acquired the archived notes, invoices, auction catalogs and reference books of American furniture dealer Albert M Sack, who died in 2011; A&S Antique Auction Company in Waco, Tex, will sell American railroad ephemera from the 1880s to the 1950s collected by Roy Gay; Freeman's auction house in Philadelphia will sell collection of early-19th-century American flags belonging to H Richard Dietrich Jr; flags at one point belonged to descendents of Maine congressman Virgil D Parris.
lead_paragraph: A collection that flaps in the wind; a paper trail for rare furniture; and everyday items and small luxuries from the glory days of American rail travel.

headline.seo: Antiques: Furniture Dossiers, Naval Flags and Railroad Items
